epd_metadata.address: Level 8, 799 Pacific Highway, Chatswood NSW 2067, Australia
epd_metadata.epd_produced_by_address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA
epd_metadata.product_category_rules: PCR 2012:01 Construction Products and Construction Services, Version 2.3, 2018-11-15

independent_third_party_verification.type: EPD process certification and data, according to ISO 14025:2006

product_description.product_name: ViroDecs Special Ready-mix concrete ECOPact Product Range - Illawarra & Nowra
product_description.description: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives. Placed on site or prefabricated, compacted and hardened by hydration of cement.

classes.normal_class: Designed for residential applications, low rise buildings, paving and driveways. Specification and ordering simplified.
classes.special_class: For major and high-end construction projects including high-rise buildings, dams, roads, bridges, public infrastructure. Specified for technical parameters and performance requirements such as high strength, durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high pumpability, architectural finishes.

product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.dangerous_goods_classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope is cradle to gate)

background_data_sources: Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI) (2017)
World Business Council for Sustainable Development (WBCSD) Cement Sustainability Initiative (CSI) Tool Project Database (International Version) (2018)
Product specific EPDs for admixtures and fibres

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight (quarries) or m² of concrete (batching plant); economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

lca_information.cut_off_criteria: No flows excluded on basis of cut-off criteria

data_quality.foreground_data: Medium or higher geographic and temporal representativeness
data_quality.background_data: Updated within 10 years as required under PCR 2012:01

lca_information.system_boundaries: Cradle to gate; excludes personnel, infrastructure and production equipment not directly consumed in process; excludes life cycle stages beyond Holcim's gate

transport_and_installation.transport_allocation: Included in LCA; allocation based on physical or economic criteria as described

scenarios: Disposal of concrete at landfill site
Reuse of recovered concrete elements in new construction works
Use of concrete debris in land restoration
Crushing/recycling of concrete: crushed concrete substitutes primary material without further processing or substitutes natural aggregates in fresh concrete
end_of_life.note: Scenarios 2, 3 and 4 can result in benefits and loads outside system boundary and should be considered in whole-of-life building studies or functional comparisons

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_process: Concrete absorbs CO2 from atmosphere through chemical reaction with hydration products; can offset CO2 emitted during cement manufacturing
carbon_emission_context.carbonation_consideration: Not considered in this EPD and not reflected in EPD results tables; recommended to consider in whole-of-life building studies per BS EN 16757:2017
carbon_emission_context.importance: Commonly known and considered by engineers when specifying special-class concrete

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.database_conformance: AusLCI dataset conforms to EN 15804 for allocation
recycled_materials_handling.note: Allocation approach of AusLCI LCA database adopted as default for secondary data and processes

additional_info.note_on_comparability: EPDs within the same product category but from different programmes may not be comparable. EPDs of construction products may not be comparable if they do not comply with EN 15804.
additional_info.disclaimer: This publication supersedes all previous literature on this subject. Specifications and details may change; users must determine suitability for their circumstances. Holcim accepts no liability for loss or damage resulting from reliance on this information.
